p: The idea of the ‘connectedness’ of the local and global leads us to a consideration of the importance of human relationships, which are fundamental to building and maintaining sustainable connections. A theme common to the Global Agenda and much social work literature is the need to place human relationships at the centre of action. As Garrett expresses ‘we live in an interconnected world that can only be economically and relationally sustained if we are collectively committed to socialist ethics and values rooted in interdependency, mutual caring and solidarity’ (2021, p. 15).
